DOC.brief_summary: Objective To investigate whether critical care ultrasound orient shock management shock patient intensive care unit ( ICU ) improve outcome . Methods Randomized control research . Patients randomly allocate two group . In critical care ultrasound orient shock management group ( CUSS group ) , treatment orient finding critical care ultrasound shock phase , control group decision monitor management make clinical team . The goal treatment group decrease lactate 20 % per 2 hour Optimization phase shock management , increase lactate level remove fluid de-escalation phase . The primary outcome measure hospital mortality 28-day mortality , secondary outcome measure length ventilation length ICU stay .
DOC.brief_title: Critical Care Ultrasound Oriented Shock Treatment ICU
DOC.criteria: SBP ＜90 mm Hg MAP ＜65 mm Hg SBP decrease ＞40mmHg need vasoactive drugs； Skin cold clammy，capillary refill time ＞4.5s，urine output of＜0.5ml/Kg.hr lactate ＞2mmol/L； SHOCK present within 6 hr . ＜18 year old； Pregnancy； Patient family member refuse enrol .
